resources.string: MIDI alias set name has already been defined.
Set name has already been defined.
Image after scaling exceeds maximum size of 8192 x 8192. Ignoring line.
A MIDI alias has been defined with only a name.
A MIDI alias can only have one channel value.
Instructions found, but no MIDI alias name has been defined yet.
A MIDI alias file must contain a {midi_aliases} set name definition.
There are multiple files in the cache that match the filename \'{%1$s}\'.
A {%1$s} tag was found on the same line as a {%2$s} tag. This is not allowed.
Both a <bars> tag and commas were found on the same line. Using tag value.
The single-use tag {%1$s} has been used multiple times in this file.
The tag {%1$s} has been used multiple times in this line.
The tag {%1$s} has been used multiple times in succession without an intervening ending tag.
The tag {%1$s} has been found before a corresponding starting tag.
The tag {%1$s} has been found with no specified value.
No set name defined in set list file.
Multiple beatstart or beatstop tags were found on the same line. Ignoring all but the first.
Could not find the root folder of the storage system.
A beatstart tag can only be used in a song with a defined BPM speed.
This set list contains %1$d unknown songs, including:
Program change trigger tags must contain between one and four values.
Song select trigger tags must contain only one value.
Control change trigger tags must contain two or three values.
MIDI parameters must be a value between 0 and 127.
MIDI channel values must be between 1 and 16.
An alias value cannot contain multiple underscores.
The channel specifier value cannot contain underscores.
Values containing underscores must be in hexadecimal.
Only the lower nibble of a value can be merged with the channel specifier.
File "%1$s" is not a valid MIDI aliasing file.
MIDI alias found with no name.
MIDI alias message found with more than two parts.
A "midi_alias" tag contains more than two parts.
Tag "%1$s" does not match any known MIDI commands or aliases.
Unknown image scaling mode, defaulting to stretch mode.
Multiple images found in one line. Only using the first one.
Text was found on a line where an image was specified. Ignoring text.
The MIDI channel must be the last parameter.
Not enough parameters supplied to MIDI command.
If a tempo is not defined by a file, this speed will be used.
If beats-per-bar is not defined by a file, this value will be used.
If bars-per-line is not defined by a file, this value will be used.
If the number of "count-in" bars is not defined by a file, this value will be used. Only applicable to beat-scrolling songs.
The height of the beat counter, as a percentage of the portrait-mode screen height.
If a song is being shown in "smooth scrolling mode", then this setting creates an automatic pause at the start of the song, factored into the total song length.
Thanks! You are officially a nice person! :)
"%1$s" is not a valid audio file.
Minimum value is %1$d, value found was %2$d.
Maximum value is %1$d, value found was %2$d.
Could not parse "%1$s" as an integer value.
Could not parse "%1$s" as a duration value (use mm:ss or just seconds).
Minimum value is %1$d, value found was %2$.2f.
Maximum value is %1$d, value found was %2$.2f.
Could not parse "%1$s" as a numeric value.
Could not parse "%1$s" as a color.
The minimum font size preference is larger than the maximum font size. Using minimum for all.
Audio track volume is not a number between 0 and 100.
A value has already been defined for {%1$s}.
Line %1$d was longer than %2$d characters. Truncating …
Total {pause} time exceeds designated song time. Disabling smooth scrolling mode.
Scrollbeat offset is greater than or equal to the number of beats in the bar. Resetting to zero.
The maximum percentage of the maximum line height that the lyrics will occupy.
The amount of time that an in-song comment will remain onscreen.
The minimum number of lines that should be visible at any one time.
The offset from the start of the song, in milliseconds, at which the backing audio track will begin.
The colour of the beat counter bar at the top of the screen.
Colour for the page-down scroll position indicators.
Highlight color for the line that is the start of a beat section.
Mimic band leader display in manual mode
If performing a song with a band leader in manual mode, this will automatically set your display to the same orientation and font sizes.
If your device has a proximity sensor, triggering it will act like pressing a "page down" pedal.
Any other key pressed on a connected keyboard will act like page-down.
Deletes all cached files, and clears all stored cloud credentials.
The colour of the marker that shows when the display will scroll.
What MIDI channels should BeatPrompter listen to?
What is the default MIDI channel to write to, unless otherwise specified?
By default, songs always play in manual scrolling mode with no backing track.
If a song has beat timings, this will send MIDI clock signals.
Highlight colour to apply to highlighted lyric text.
If a song contains this variation, it will be loaded by default.
Any flat chords will be converted to appropriate sharp chords.
Chords that contain b/# characters will be converted to use ♭/♯.
Highlight colour to apply to the current line.
The background will pulse this colour in time to the rhythm.
Any chord text that isn\'t recognised as a valid chord will be shown in this color.
Shows the scrolling style of the song as an icon in the main list.
Displays the song chords above the lyrics at the correct point.
Highlights the current line with your chosen highlight colour.
Highlights the start of beat sections with your chosen highlight colour.
Show page down scroll position markers
Shows the position that the display will be scrolled to when you press page-down.
In the main song list, show an icon indicating that a song has a backing track.
In the main song list, show the key of the song.
In the main song list, show the year of the song (if defined).
Where should the song icon (if defined) be displayed?
In the main song list, show the rating of the song.
Displays the song list in larger text.
The background will pulse in time to the rhythm.
If true, any selected tag filters will be cleared whenever you switch folders/setlists/etc.
This is the folder that the BeatPrompter song files are stored in.
To only see the comments that are meant for you on the song introduction screen, enter your name(s) here.
The smallest font size that will be used in beat-scrolling mode.
The largest font size that will be used in beat-scrolling mode.
The smallest font size that will be used in smooth-scrolling mode.
The largest font size that will be used in smooth-scrolling mode.
The smallest font size that will be used in manual-scrolling mode.
The largest font size that will be used in manual-scrolling mode.
Always use the beat-scrolling font size preferences.
Uses the beat-scrolling font size preferences for all songs.
In the beat counter section, highlight the beat that the display will scroll on.
What text to display over the beat counter.
Show song key on title screen.
Displays the key of the song on the song title screen.
Show capo setting on title screen.
Displays the capo setting on the song title screen.
Shows the first beat in the beat indicator section.
Creates a clicking sound in time with the beat. Only applicable to beat-scrolling songs.
On when there is no backing track
Show song BPM on title screen
Should the initial BPM of the song be shown on the song title screen?
Stores data on external storage (SD card, etc). Changing this will clear the cache.
If selected, song data will be stored in the custom location. Changing this will clear the cache.
Where should BeatPrompter store cached song and audio files? Changing this will clear the cache.
What controls should be available while a song is playing?
Where are your song files stored?
What type of MIDI connection do you use?
Should the next song start automatically when the current song ends?
Should the MIDI trigger message be output when the song starts?
Configure how your device communicates with band members.
Specify which device to connect to when in band-member mode.
Can MIDI trigger messages interrupt the current song?
When paused, or at title screen
When paused, at title screen, or on last line of song
Unless specified in the file, this is the default volume that backing tracks will play at.
Amount of latency to compensate for in audio playback.
Makes all lines the same height
Could not load audio file. Is it missing or corrupt?
Although you can use it in portrait mode, BeatPrompter works best in landscape mode.
BeatPrompter reads all your song files, audio files, set lists and more from cloud or local storage. It currently supports Google Drive, Dropbox or Microsoft OneDrive.
With a bit of modification to your song files, BeatPrompter will keep the display perfectly in time with the beat. Never too fast, never too slow, and always nice and big and readable!
BeatPrompter doesn\'t just display lyrics and chords. It can play backing tracks, and control (and respond to) external MIDI devices too.
BeatPrompter is a lyrics and chords prompter app that places the emphasis on timing and readability.
MIDI offset should be a numerical value or beat offset characters.
MIDI tags can contain a maximum of one semi-colon character.
MIDI event offset puts it before the start of the song.
Blank value found in MIDI directive.
Invalid argument index found in MIDI directive.
Invalid byte value found in MIDI directive.
Only MIDI tags that are on or after the first song line can have offsets.
The maximum MIDI event offset is 16 beats or 10 seconds.

{t:BeatPrompter Demo Song}
 {st:Demo Song}
 {audio:demo_song.mp3}
 {bpm:110}{bpb:4}{bpl:2}{count:0}
 [G]BeatPrompter is an app that displays
 lyrics and [Em]chords in time with a beat.
 [C]It never goes too fast or slow,
 [D]So it can display the text really big!
 [C]We're currently in [D]standard 4/4 time
 [G]with one line every two bars.
 ,,,,[Em]But watch: this [C]line lasts for [D]four bars!
 [G]The bar along the top of the screen
 [Em]shows the beat progression.
 [C]The little marker [D]at the end
 [G]shows when the display will scroll.
 [Em]Sometimes a line scrolls a bit sooner
 [C]Like this [D]one!<<
 [G]And sometimes there's a pause in a song
 {pause:5}like [D]this one right here!
 {bpm:130}[G]And now the speed has changed.
 [G]But BeatPrompter can cope with that.
 [Em]It can play backing tracks too
 [C]and it also has MIDI functionality.
 [D]Check the documentation for full details.
 [G]tinyurl.com/beatprompterdocs
 [Em]I hope you like it!
No storage system has been selected.
No storage folder has been selected.
The selected song file has no lines.

There was an error communicating with the storage service ("%1$s").

Not all of the files were fetched or scanned successfully.

Check your connection and try again.
Allow BeatPrompter to communicate with other devices via Bluetooth.
Allow BeatPrompter to read files from local folders.
What player should the app use for audio playback?
Failed to authenticate for Google Drive access.
Variation names have already been defined.
Replace sequences of exactly three dots with the Unicode ellipsis character.
Remove single full-stops or commas from the end of lines.
What Bluetooth devices should be considered for MIDI?
An error occurred while reading the database
An error occurred while writing the database.
with_midi_* directives cannot be used in aliases that contain parameters
A MIDI alias that is flagged as a MIDI command must not have parameters
MIDI Control Change triggers are only valid for aliases that are flagged as MIDI commands.
\'%1$s\' could not be parsed as a valid key
Failed to calculate new key (shifting %1$s by %2$d semitones)
{transpose} tag should not contain a numeric value greater than 11, or less than -11
{chord_map} tag must contain two values separated by =
